name: Downy mildew
summary: Downy mildew is a plant disease caused by water mold pathogens, affecting a wide range of plants, characterized by yellowing leaves and a downy fungal growth on the undersides.

cause_of_disease.describe: Caused by oomycetes in the family Peronosporaceae, which thrive in cool, moist environments.
High humidity and cool temperatures favor the development of downy mildew spores.
Dense planting or lack of airflow around plants can increase vulnerability to downy mildew.

steps: Apply fungicides containing copper or other compounds effective against oomycetes.
Ensure thorough coverage of the plant, especially undersides of leaves.
Remove and destroy infected plant material to reduce spore spread.
Rotate crops to prevent the build-up of pathogens in the soil.
Increase plant spacing to improve air circulation.
Avoid overhead watering to reduce humidity around the leaves.

tips: Plant resistant varieties to reduce susceptibility to downy mildew.
Monitor environmental conditions and apply preventative treatments during wet and cool periods.
Implement proper sanitation practices, such as cleaning tools and disposing of plant debris.
